H0.text: Xylem carries water from the roots to the leaves, correctly identifying the way materials are transported in a plant.

H1.text: Phloem carries minerals from the roots to the leaves in a plant.

H2.text: Xylem carries sugars from the flowers to the stems, correctly identifying how materials are transported in a plant.

H3.text: Phloem carries water from the flowers to the stems in a plant.

A4.text: The basic function of the xylem is to transport water upward from the roots to parts of the plants such as stems and leaves, but it also transports nutrients.
